title: Applied Nuclear Physics
description: Radioactive decay and radiations, nuclear properties, interactions of neutrons, physical principles of power reactors, nuclear fusion, radiation monitoring, and safety.
keywords: phys 473 applied nuclear physics radiation detection radioactive decay isotopes neutron interactions nuclear reactors fusion fission dosimetry shielding nuclear instrumentation safety monitoring gamma spectroscopy particle detectors medical imaging nuclear power radiation safety

title: Engineering Physics Project II
description: Design and implement an autonomous robot simulation using Linux-based development tools. Apply machine learning for navigation and control. Deploy the robot in Gazebo running on a ROS infrastructure, integrating sensors, control systems, and real-time decision-making.
keywords: enph 353 robotics reinforcement learning machine learning linux gazebo ros autonomous control neural networks computer vision imitation learning simulation sensors lidar camera navigation control systems embedded software real-time systems robotic perception python cpp

title: Applications of Classical Mechanics
description: Particle mechanics: Euler's equations, tops and gyroscopes, motion of the Earth, Lagrangian and Hamiltonian methods. Variational principles in optics and mechanics, Liouville's theorem, and the relationship between classical and quantum mechanics.
keywords: phys 350 classical mechanics lagrangian hamiltonian dynamics oscillations rigid body motion variational principles energy conservation orbital mechanics gyroscopes rotation angular momentum analytical mechanics euler equations

title: Machine Design
description: Selection of flexible drives, bearings, fluid power system components, and couplings. Design of shafts, bolted joints, and power screws. Design and selection of gears, gear trains, and mechanisms.
keywords: mech 325 machine design mechanical engineering components stress analysis gears bearings shafts couplings bolted joints power screws design optimization fatigue analysis finite element analysis mechanical systems

title: Digital Systems and Microcomputers
description: Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential logic design, memory and programmable devices, organization and operation of microcomputers, data/address bus organization, input-output interfacing, and assembly programming.
keywords: cpen 312 digital systems microcomputers embedded hardware cpu microcontroller fpga logic gates sequential circuits combinational circuits assembly programming memory organization bus interfacing digital design computer architecture embedded programming

title: Applied Linear Algebra
description: Applications of linear algebra to problems in science and engineering; use of computer algebra systems for solving problems in linear algebra.
keywords: math 307 applied linear algebra matrices eigenvalues eigenvectors systems computational vector spaces linear transformations matrix decomposition gaussian elimination least squares data analysis linear systems numerical computation

title: Applied Complex Analysis
description: Functions of a complex variable, Cauchy-Riemann equations, contour integration, Laurent series, residues, integrals of multi-valued functions, Fourier transforms.
keywords: math 305 complex analysis contour integration conformal mapping cauchy-riemann laurent series residue theorem analytic functions fourier transforms laplace transforms poles singularities

title: Introduction to Quantum Mechanics
description: Principles and applications of quantum mechanics, wave mechanics, the Schr√∂dinger equation, expectation values, Hermitian operators, commuting observables, one-dimensional systems, harmonic oscillators, angular momentum, and three-dimensional systems.
keywords: phys 304 quantum mechanics wave functions operators schrodinger uncertainty principle superposition eigenstates energy quantization harmonic oscillator angular momentum spin potential wells atomic structure probability density

title: Electricity and Magnetism
description: Maxwell's equations and their applications, electrical fields and potentials of static charge distributions, current, fields of moving charges, magnetic fields, electromagnetic induction.
keywords: phys 301 electromagnetism electrostatics magnetic fields maxwell equations induction gauss law faraday ampere lorentz force potentials charge distributions electromagnetic waves boundary conditions dielectrics capacitors

title: Introduction to Fluid Mechanics
description: Fluid properties, statics, kinematics, dynamics, energy and momentum principles, laminar and turbulent flow, pipe flow, and centrifugal pumps.
keywords: mech 280 fluid mechanics flow dynamics viscosity laminar turbulent bernoulli equation continuity equation pumps pipes pressure drag lift cfd boundary layer fluid statics

title: Engineering Materials Laboratory
description: Laboratory investigation of material properties including mechanical testing, microstructure analysis, and phase transformations.
keywords: apsc 279 materials lab mechanical testing microstructure phase transformation metals ceramics polymers microscopy tensile testing hardness testing fracture analysis

title: Signals and Systems
description: LTI systems, convolution, Fourier series and transforms, z-transform, sampling, filtering, modulation, feedback systems, and stability.
keywords: elec 221 signals systems fourier transform laplace transform z-transform convolution time-domain frequency-domain sampling modulation filtering feedback stability control theory

title: Engineering Materials
description: Atomic bonding, crystal structures, mechanical properties of metals, ceramics, polymers, and composites; corrosion, heat treatment, and materials selection.
keywords: apsc 278 engineering materials metals ceramics polymers composites structure bonding crystal defects corrosion heat treatment phase diagrams mechanical properties materials science testing

title: Mechanics II
description: Systems of particles, kinematics and kinetics of rigid bodies, energy and momentum, rotating coordinates.
keywords: enph 270 mechanics dynamics kinematics rigid body energy momentum rotation angular velocity torque plane motion particle systems

title: Introduction to Mechanics of Materials
description: Frames and trusses, normal and shear stresses and strains, bending, torsion, transformation of stress and strain, Mohr's circle, failure criteria.
keywords: mech 260 mechanics of materials stress strain deformation bending torsion shear moment diagrams mohr circle trusses beams yield strength failure criteria material properties

title: Experimental Techniques
description: Hands-on laboratory course focused on building and characterizing analog and digital circuits. Students design a motor driver circuit using DACs, D-latches, op-amps, and logic components, while learning to use oscilloscopes, function generators, and multimeters. Emphasis on data collection, uncertainty analysis, and maintaining a detailed laboratory logbook.
keywords: enph 259 experimental techniques analog electronics op amp dac dlatch motor driver circuit function generator oscilloscope instrumentation measurement uncertainty analysis lab report data acquisition calibration sensors error propagation

title: Partial Differential Equations
description: Introduction to partial differential equations; Fourier series; the heat, wave, and potential equations; boundary-value problems; numerical methods.
keywords: math 257 partial differential equations pde wave heat laplace boundary value problems fourier series separation of variables diffusion equation potential theory

title: Heat and Thermodynamics
description: Thermal properties of matter, heat transfer by conduction, convection, and radiation, heat engines, refrigeration, and the laws of thermodynamics.
keywords: enph 257 thermodynamics heat energy entropy temperature cycles engines refrigeration conduction convection radiation kinetic theory gas laws phase transitions

title: Ordinary Differential Equations
description: Linear and nonlinear systems, phase plane analysis, Laplace transforms, and numerical methods.
keywords: math 255 ordinary differential equations ode linear nonlinear systems laplace transform phase plane stability numerical methods modeling

title: Introduction to Instrument Design (Pet Rescue: Autonomous Robot)
description: A project-based course where students design, build, and test an autonomous robot to complete a complex task without human intervention. The course integrates mechanical design, electronic circuit development, and microcontroller programming. Students apply principles of feedback control, sensing, and actuation while fabricating custom components and iteratively improving system performance through testing and analysis.
keywords: enph 253 instrument design robotics esp32 embedded systems pid control op amp state machine sensors actuators 2d tof lidar dc motor servo claw manipulator kicad onshape autonomous robot fabrication laser cutting milling turning 3d printing waterjet

title: Introduction to Modern Physics
description: Wave-particle duality, special relativity, atomic and nuclear processes, and introduction to quantum mechanical devices and techniques.
keywords: phys 250 modern physics quantum relativity atomic nuclear solid state wave-particle duality photoelectric effect bohr model special relativity quantum devices

title: Software Construction I
description: Design, implementation, and reasoning about software systems: abstraction, specification, testing, verification, design patterns, concurrency.
keywords: cpen 221 software engineering java object-oriented programming design patterns abstraction testing verification concurrency software architecture algorithms data structures inheritance polymorphism

title: Multivariable and Vector Calculus
description: Partial differentiation, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, divergence and Stokes' theorems.
keywords: math 217 multivariable calculus vector calculus gradient divergence curl surface integrals line integrals stokes theorem divergence theorem partial derivatives optimization

title: Linear Circuits
description: Analysis of electric and electronic circuits, RLC circuits, phasors, op-amps, diodes, BJT, and FET circuits.
keywords: elec 204 linear circuits ac dc rlc analysis bode plot laplace transform thevenin norton op-amp diodes transistors filters circuit theory

title: Technical Communication Engineering Physics
description: Written and oral communication in business correspondence, engineering design methods, report preparation, and oral presentations.
keywords: apsc 202 technical communication engineering writing presentations reports documentation business correspondence proposal writing professional communication

title: Mechanics I
description: Statics of particles and rigid bodies, kinematics, Newton's laws, friction, impulse, momentum, work, and energy.
keywords: phys 170 mechanics statics dynamics energy momentum rotation oscillations equilibrium friction work power force torque newton laws

title: Introductory Physics Laboratory for Engineers
description: Experimental design, measurement and analysis techniques in introductory physics.
keywords: phys 159 physics laboratory experiments measurement uncertainty analysis sensors data acquisition data analysis graphing report writing

title: Introductory Physics for Engineers II
description: Electricity and magnetism, DC and AC circuits, optics.
keywords: phys 158 electricity magnetism circuits ac dc optics waves fields light lenses interference electromagnetism

title: Introductory Physics for Engineers I
description: Heat, thermodynamics, oscillations, waves, and sound.
keywords: phys 157 mechanics waves thermodynamics heat oscillations sound motion forces energy conservation

title: Linear Systems
description: 2D and 3D geometry, vectors and matrices, eigenvalues, vibrations, and computer solutions of large systems.
keywords: math 152 linear algebra matrices vectors eigenvalues eigenvectors gaussian elimination systems vibrations matrix operations geometry computational

title: Writing and Research in the Disciplines
description: Academic writing and research skills including argumentation, critical reading, source integration, and documentation.
keywords: wrds 150 writing research communication academic argumentation critical reading source integration citation english composition

title: Integral Calculus with Applications
description: Definite integral, integration techniques, applications, modeling, and infinite series.
keywords: math 101 integral calculus integration series area volume applications numerical methods convergence

title: Differential Calculus with Applications
description: Derivatives of elementary functions, applications, graphing, optimization, and modeling.
keywords: math 100 differential calculus derivatives limits optimization continuity slope tangents functions rates change

title: Introduction to Computation in Engineering Design
description: Structured programming in C with applications to engineering problem solving, including algorithms, control structures, functions, arrays, and file I/O.
keywords: apsc 160 programming c algorithms computation control structures functions arrays file io structured programming problem solving engineering applications

title: Introduction to Engineering II
description: Engineering design process, sustainability, prototype testing, team functioning, engineering graphics, and technical communication.
keywords: apsc 101 engineering design projects teamwork communication sustainability prototyping testing graphics technical communication

title: Introduction to Engineering I
description: Introduction to engineering disciplines, ethics, design process, sustainability, prototyping, and communication.
keywords: apsc 100 engineering design teamwork ethics sustainability prototyping project management design process communication
